Barcelona are raiding Japanese football to boost their B team.

Mundo Deportivo says Hiroki Abe, 20, and Jun Nishikawa, 17, are both on Barca's agenda.

Abe, of Kashima Antlers, is part of Japan's Copa America squad, while Nishikawa, a striker, is tied to Cerezo Osaka. Nishikawa plays for Spanish coach Miguel Ángel Lotina at Cerezo.

Indeed, Lotina rates the teen as among the best young players in Asia. Nishikawa played for Japan at the U20 World Cup.

Barca are in talks for both young players, with the preference being an initial loan arrangement.

Barcelona have moved to sign Kashima Antlers midfielder and Japan international Hiroki Abe, according to Diario Sport.

The 20-year-old appeared in all three matches for his nation in this summer’s Copa America tournament, having previously starred for Japan at youth level.

He has played 48 games in the J1 League for Kashima and netted four goals and won the Young Player of the Year award for the division in 2018.

Manchester United have reportedly made a bid for Barcelona target Dani Olmo.

Olmo, who helped Spain to the Euro Under-21 Championship, began his career in the Barca academy.

But now reports in Croatia suggest United have bid £36m for the Dinamo Zagreb star.

Real Madrid and Bayer Leverkusen have also been linked to the 21-year-old attacking midfielder.

Barcelona have reportedly set a date for Antoine Griezmann’s official unveiling and medical test.

That’s according to Spanish newspaper Mundo Deportivo, who claim Griezmann will be paraded at the Nou Camp on July 11.

The Frenchman’s release clause dropped to £107million on July 1, and it’s claimed he will sign a five-year deal worth £288k per-week.

The report says Griezmann will undergo medical and physical tests on Sunday July 14 before joining first-team pre-season training the next day.
